intro: Pleiostachya leiostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments in the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in three rows along its cylindrical stem. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are clustered in dense, cylindrical structures. Pleiostachya leiostachya plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
